top_comment.text:
Pretty sure Mr. Knightley's first name was George or Greg or something like 
that.. but overall, adorable!﻿
top_comment.author: ForeignEquus

comments.text: Oh, okay! Thanks! +chloepenguins
comments.author: ForeignEquus

comments.text:
They changed it to Alex because there was already a George and a Georgiana 
in the Lizzie Bennet Diaries. So they didn't want them to confused or 
whatever. :)
comments.author: chloepenguins

top_comment.text:
I started to watch this then I decided to stop. I feel I should read Emma 
before I watch this series, just as I did with P&P and the LBD, but mainly 
because Emma is very annoying and I want to understand her better. I mean, 
I voted for Persuasion when they asked which one they wanted to adapt 
next...﻿
top_comment.author: RuaranicusPond

comments.text:
Just FYI: there's also "Clueless." It's also a retelling of Emma, so that 
gives you a fairly good idea of what kind of person Emma is supposed to be.
comments.author: Katerine459

comments.text:
Definitely read it! It is so fun to see the adaptations from someone from 
the 1800s to modern day. And I have to say, it's pretty accurate!
comments.author: Faryal S

top_comment.text:
Point of annoyance..."my father and I" not, "my father and me."  Bu thank 
you for creating this.  I will be using this for my classroom assignment 
when we read Emma.﻿
top_comment.author: Medusa Negrita

comments.text:
I hope you are no longer annoyed now that you know "my father and me" is, 
in fact, correctly used here.
comments.author: Leighla

comments.text:
"with my father and me" is correct.  A simple way to see how this works is 
to drop the other name.  You would never say "with I".  Try it, it works.
comments.author: Mary Goodman

comments.text:
"with my father and me" is correct. With is a preposition and you use an 
object pronoun with prepositions, not a subject pronoun.  So you'd use me, 
not I.
comments.author: AngelsOnScreen

top_comment.text: Not sure how I feel about this so far. Feels a bit fake compared to LBD﻿
top_comment.author: GravityBee1

comments.text: Hmm I see! I'll have to give it another try then, thanks! :]
comments.author: GravityBee1

comments.text:
That's because Emma herself is.... not exactly fake, but MUCH different 
than Lizzie. Emma grows on you eventually though:D
comments.author: Alyssa Rosenne

top_comment.text:
Finally watching these after I finished LBD a little while ago. This one is 
pretty good! 
Does anyone know if they're releasing any more? And when the episodes are 
uploaded? ﻿

comments.text: It has just ended and I am drowning in FEELS.

comments.text: Every Monday and Thursday at 9am, not counting occasional hiatuses. :)
comments.author: Bonnie Rose

top_comment.text:
So first Pride and Prejudice and now Emma... I hope they do either

comments.text:

strayed so far away from the story. I would love to see Jonny Lee Miller as

comments.author: cagneychick182

comments.text:
+cagneychick182 I have! Even though I like Ciaran as Captain Fitzwilliam, I

still haven't seen her being portrayed as I would like to :(
comments.author: Suellen Almeida

comments.text: +Suellen Almeida Have you seen the Ciaran Hinds version? I love that movie.
comments.author: cagneychick182

comments.text: Persuasion, Persuasion, Persuasion, Persuasion, Persuasion!!!!

comments.text:
Persuasion, Persuasion, Persuasion! Till this day I have not seen a single

comments.text: Persuasion! Persuasion! Persuasion!

top_comment.text:
I maybe a little late in bringing this up and I may not get an answer but 
Why did Knightley's first name change from George to Alex in this?﻿

comments.text:
Plus there's already a George Wickham in LBD who I really don't want to 
associate with Knightley. AT ALL.
comments.author: oxChocolattexo

comments.text: Persist with it - you'll get used to it :D
comments.author: Grey The Shy Girl

comments.text:
+Grey The Shy Girl
Totally stinks. Alex Knightly just doesn't work for me. I know I'm only one 
ep in, but I have the feeling this won't be nearly as good as LBD.

comments.text:
There was already a George (and a Georgiana/Gigi!) in the LBD and they 
didn't want it to get confusing.
comments.author: Grey The Shy Girl

captions.text:
Emma Woodhouse: beautiful,
clever, and brilliant!

They are many intriguing female entrepreneurs
in the love and lifestyle industry

But none are more dynamic
or have more potential

than young Ms. Woodhouse!
So I run the matchmaking and lifestyle division of the developing
Highbury Partners Lifestyle Group! I know

complicated. 
But in nine words: I make your life better

and I never fail! Currently I hold a
perfect 19 for 19 client success record.

And you wanna know whose number twenty?
Meet Ryan Weston

35. You've heard Cuddly Cupcakes the one
with over 200 locations across the Greater
United States?!
Yeah....C.E.O!

Meet Annie Taylor, personal chef and power
homemaker. Her convection baking skills
would blow the

buttons off your cashmere cardigan. 
Mr. Cupcake mobile

Ms. Power Homemaker perfect for each
other, right?
but how perfect? They put a ring on it!
And all because of me! Who am I?

I am Emma Woodhouse and this
marriage is Emma Approved!

"I am Emma Woodhouse"
Written by Bernie Su
So let's talk about Annie and Ryan

two perfect people who may have never met,
may have never locked eyes across a
crowded room

and may never have locked lips on the
beach at sunset.
Boom! Picture! Cuz it happened!

Alex Knightley: Emma? 
Emma: Yes?

Knightley: Are you talking to yourself?
Emma: No. I'm talking to the world!

Knightley: Seriously, what are you doing?
Emma: Documenting.

Emma: Alex Knightley, Partner, Business
development, book-keeping, boring stuff.

Knightley: important stuff
Emma: still boring

Knightley: still important
Emma: boring me and now them

Knightley: who is them?
Emma: Future editors of this documentary

Knightley: Okay, and what exactly is it we're documenting? 
Emma: My greatness!

Knightley: For what purpose?
Emma: Future achievements!

Knightley: What types of achievements?
Emma: Like when I receive my prestigious
Lifetime Achievement Award in Lifestyle Excellence!

Bettering the world one life at a time
I'll be like Oprah
but better! It's not a joke!

Knightley: Oh I know, well I'll
let you keep doing...

Knightley: whatever this is.
Emma: Documenting my
greatness for when I receive my future

Lifetime Achievement Award in Lifestyle
Excellence!

Knightley: And when you get a moment, post greatness
documenting, I have some important boring
stuff to talk about.
Emma: Okay yeah yeah go now go busy busy

so back to Annie and Ryan or should I say
the future Mister and Mrs. Ryan Weston!

This all started one day when Mr.
Ryan Weston was having dinner with my
father and me.

So there was a lot of talk, talk, business, business,
blah, blah, but the important thing was
that through all of Ryan's long cupcake cuddly days

he was really lonely! he didn't exactly
say it but I knew

It was totally obvious, trust me. So I
made sure the next time we all got

together he got to meet my very dear and
very single friend

Annie! A little push here and a
little plant there and magic!

Knightley: Hello Emma
 Emma: What are you too lazy to walk here?!

Knightley: I'm too busy doing
important boring stuff.

Emma: Good boy, stay focused. 20 for 20!
Knightley: speaking of 20

Knightley: Annie called, sounded important,
wants you to call her back.

Emma: and why are you answering my calls?
Knightley: Because you still haven't hired an
assistant yet.
Which you need to. Are you recording this conversation?

Emma: No!
Knightley: You are aware

that recording this conversation without
my consent is technically illegal?

Emma: I am. 
Knightley: Hmm

Well about that assistant position there's
a lot of quality resumes over here, so you should --
Emma: We'll get back to that later but for now
Annie: Hey, Emma

Emma: The amazing, the
awesome, the alluring

Annie Taylor! By the way I loved the
centerpieces that you picked out for the reception.
Very Emma Approved!
Annie: About that, there's something wrong.

Emma: I don't want you to worry Annie I
can get you those flowers. I know

they're a little rare this time of year, but
I'll just call a favor!
Annie: It's not that, it's just --
Emma: Does Ryan still want a shot luge for the reception?
Shot luges are so not Emma Approved.
Annie: Emma, I'm thinking about calling off the wedding.

title: I am Emma Woodhouse - Emma Approved: Ep 1
